{{other uses|Declaration of Independence (disambiguation)}} {{more citations needed|date=November 2014}} A '''declaration of independence''' or '''declaration of statehood''' is an assertion by a defined territory that it is [[independence|independent]] and constitutes a [[Sovereign state|state]]. Such places are usually declared from part or all of the [[Wiktionary: Territory|territory]] of another state or failed state, or are breakaway territories from within the larger state. In 2010, the UN's [[International Court of Justice]] ruled in [[International Court of Justice advisory opinion on Kosovo's declaration of independence|an advisory opinion in Kosovo]] that "International law contains no prohibition on declarations of independence",{{cite web |url=http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/141/15987.pdf |title=Accordance with International Law of the Unilateral Declaration of Independence in Respect of Kosovo |publisher=Icj-cij.org |accessdate=2014-02-14 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100821055950/http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/141/15987.pdf |archivedate=2010-08-21 }} though the state from which the territory wishes to secede may regard the declaration as [[rebellion]], which may lead to a [[war of independence]] or a constitutional settlement to resolve the crisis. ==List of declarations of independence== {{hatnote|This [[Wikipedia:Incomplete lists|incomplete list]] is not intended to be exhaustive.}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !Region !width=220pt|Declaration !class="unsortable"|Date !Year !width=150pt|Association !class="unsortable" width=220pt|Signatories!!First recognising state |- |{{Flagicon image|Flag of Albanian Provisional Government (1912-1914).svg}} [[Albania]] ||[[Albanian Declaration of Independence]]||November 28||1912||[[Ottoman Empire]]||[[Assembly of Vlorë]]|| [[Austro-Hungarian Empire]] |- |{{Flagicon image|Flag of Argentina (alternative).svg}} [[United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata]]
